posts.post_content:
Erik's Random card 6/24/2011  
This card was not in the design hand off. Instead, design put in Oversold Cemetery.  
  
However Alara block had a lot of cycling creatures, and our FFL was soon based around Oversold Cemetery generating +1 card per turn, with various disruptive effects. The FFL'rs asked for this to be replaced, so I made it a hole. That means that this card does not exist, and we will be back with another card soon.  
  
I sent out a batch of "hole submission requests" with lose de\*\*\*ions such as "a rare black non-creature card." I tend to send out about 5 or so in a batch. If there are too many, people look at the long request and often send nothing.  
  
Later we had a meeting to look at each of the holes, the submissions, the rest of the file, and figure what should go in. Typically our printout of the file is in WUBRG order, so I like to put the submission in the same order. When we got to the "rare black non-creature card" hole, Matt Place started reading his copy of th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Erik's Random card 6/24/2011
This card was not in the design hand off. Instead, design put in Oversold Cemetery.

However Alara block had a lot of cycling creatures, and our FFL was soon based around Oversold Cemetery generating +1 card per turn, with various disruptive effects. The FFL'rs asked for this to be replaced, so I made it a hole. That means that this card does not exist, and we will be back with another card soon.

I sent out a batch of "hole submission requests" with lose de***ions such as "a rare black non-creature card." I tend to send out about 5 or so in a batch. If there are too many, people look at the long request and often send nothing.

Later we had a meeting to look at each of the holes, the submissions, the rest of the file, and figure what should go in. Typically our printout of the file is in WUBRG order, so I like to put the submission in the same order. When we got to the "rare black non-creature card" hole, Matt Place started reading his copy of th... (see all)

Posted By: Swiftgamer18 (7/11/2009 6:31:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card can be good in the right circumstances. For one, it makes basic lifegain spells that much more viable. You tend to think a lot differently of angel's mercy when it becomes burn 7 gain 7 for 4 rather than just lifegain. Best w/b combos with this card - necromancer's covenant, tainted sigil, tendrils of corruption, deathgreeter, soul warden. however, fairly high cost, and very situational. Needless to say, by itself, or as a topdeck, this card fails completely. 4/5
posts.html:
This card can be good in the right circumstances. For one, it makes basic lifegain spells that much more viable. Best w/b combos with this card - necromancer's covenant, tainted sigil, tendrils of corruption, deathgreeter, soul warden. however, fairly high cost, and very situational. Needless to say, by itself, or as a topdeck, this card fails completely. 4/5

Posted By: Admiral_Ferret (5/21/2012 12:45:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
if you're using this card, you really need to USE this card.  
  
four-player game, I'm using my monoblack Vamp deck, and I'd been pretty quiet all game. little spot removal on creatures coming after me, but nothing big. I almost have to sneak up on people with this deck.  
  
turn 5 is where it got hilarious. drop [Gauntlet of Power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gauntlet of Power), chose black. next turn, [Wound Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wound Reflection) and Sanguine hit the board. next turn, [Diabolic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Tutor) for the second Sanguine and dropped it.  
  
turn 7? that's when [Blood Tribute](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Tribute) gets used. Blood Tribute hits first opponent - he's at just over 30 life. He loses 16, I gain it. I then redirect 16 damage to each other opponent - once for each Sanguine. all opponents then take another 16 damage from Wound Reflection. 'gg nubz lol'  
  
TIMMAY!
posts.html:

turn 7? that's when Blood Tribute gets used. Blood Tribute hits first opponent - he's at just over 30 life. He loses 16, I gain it. I then redirect 16 damage to each other opponent - once for each Sanguine. all opponents then take another 16 damage from Wound Reflection. 'gg nubz lol'

TIMMAY!

posts.post_content:
This thing plus [Tainted Sigil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Sigil) and a lifelinker = owned.  
  
Let's say you swing with your 6/6 flying lifelink [Serra Ascendant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Ascendant) (as if that card is not broken on its own):  
  
Ascendant swings for 6. You gain 6 life, Tainted Bond kicks in, opponent loses 6 life (that's 12 lost already).  
  
Rock the Tainted Sigil, you gain 12 life, Bond kicks in, opponent takes 12 damage.  
  
Result: ouch.
posts.html:
This thing plus Tainted Sigil and a lifelinker = owned.

Let's say you swing with your 6/6 flying lifelink Serra Ascendant (as if that card is not broken on its own):

Ascendant swings for 6. You gain 6 life, Tainted Bond kicks in, opponent loses 6 life (that's 12 lost already).

Rock the Tainted Sigil, you gain 12 life, Bond kicks in, opponent takes 12 damage.

Result: ouch.
